column4: I just saw that i have many open ports on my computer, how do i manage ports in ubuntu?
i take it you opened ports on your router (to your local ip) ? as ubuntus firewall is disabled by default
sudo ufw enable, then sudo ufw allow 22 for eg
i take it you have no access to your router
ok well just close the ports you dont need in the router
what does the command (as root) ss -l
you shouldnt need one, its pretty straightforward
cool. make sure you're not using DMZ (sounds like you might be)
it shouldnt be enabled by default. who normally sets up your router?
not sure what they did. normally all ports are closed unless you specially open them
